intro: Diplostelma pumila, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and produces tubular, pale green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the warmer months.
